children.name: gambler x
children.definition: gambler sb who gambles, especially someone who gambles a lot and cannot stop:con bạc
examples: jack was a great drinker and gambler.
de niro plays sam ‘ace’ rothstein, a professional gambler.
compulsive gamblersb who cannot stop gambling heavy gambler someone who gambles a lot : tay nghiện cờ bạc nặng
it was rumoured that he was a heavy gambler and lost large sums in monte carlo.
a self-help group forcompulsivegamblers

children.name: tipster x
children.definition: tipster sb who gives information about which horse is likely to win a race : người mách nước
examples: all the tipsters were wrong about the gold medal winner.

children.name: bookmaker x
children.definition: bookmaker (informalbookie) sb whose job is to collect money that people want to risk on the result of a race, competition etc, and who pays them if they guess correctly : nhà cái
examples: uk bookmakers, casinos and betting shops make billions of pounds every year.

children.name: croupier x
children.definition: croupiersb whose job is to collect and pay out money where people play cards, roulette etc for money at a casino : người hồ lì (ở sòng bài)
examples: tertiary colleges have closed regular courses to train croupiers and dealers for the casinos.

children.name: gamble c2
children.definition: gamble to try to win money, for example by playing cards or guessing which horse will win a race:cờ bạc, cá cược
examples: eddie loved to gamble, and would spend most evenings at the roulette table.
their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
i like to gamble when i play cards - it makes it more interesting.
gamble on
jack loves gambling on the horses.
he gamblesonthe horses (= horse races) .
gamble away[m]waste a lot of money by gambling
roger gambled away all his money in a las vegas casino.
she inherited $50,000 but gambled it away.
he gambledawayall of our savings.

children.name: bet c1
children.definition: bet to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event : cược
examples: how much do you want to bet?
bet (sb) that
he bet me £10 that i wouldn’t do it.
bet (sth) on sth
she bet all her money on a horse that came last.
jerry bet $1000 on the game.
bet against
i wouldn’t bet against him winning the championship this year.

children.name: back x
children.definition: back to gamble money on a particular horse, team, or person that you think will win a particular competition:cá cược
examples: we backed a horse named travelling light that finished first at 10-1.
the horse i backed came in last.
back sth/sb to win sth
uncle barry backed arsenal to win the fa cup.

children.name: play for money a1
children.definition: play for money to gamble money on the result of a game which you are playing, for example cards:chơi tiền
examples: ‘are we playing for money here, gentlemen?’ he said as he approached the pool table.
you’re allowed to play cards in the bar, but not for money.

children.name: have a flutter x
children.definition: have a flutter uk informal to gamble a small amount of money, especially on the result of a horse race - use this especially about sb who does not gamble very often: cược (vặt)
examples: i’m not a heavy gambler, but i like to have a flutter from time to time.
have a flutter on
i had a little flutter on the grand national and won £5.
aunty paula likes tohavea bit of a flutteronthe horses.

children.name: have a bet c2
children.definition: have a bet to try to win money by guessing who will win a race or game:cá cược
examples: i don’t bet very often.
have a bet on sth
we usually have a bet on the grand prix.
are you going to have a bet on the race?

children.name: play x
children.definition: play to risk money, especially on the results of races or business deals, hoping to win more money : chơi
examples: he playsthe horses/the stock market.

children.name: bet c2
children.definition: bet an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk : tiền cá cược
examples: a £50 bet
bet on
a few of ushadabeton who’d get married first.
place/put/lay a bet on sthshe placed a bet on a horse called beethoven.
heplaced/puta betonthe grey horse.
i put $20 on the cowboys to win.
he put £50 on middlesborough to beat manchester united at odds of 3-1.
i think i’ll put a bet on the next race.
take a bet(= accept sb’s money as part of a bet)
they're taking bets on the result of the election now.
bookmakers are alreadytaking betson the outcome.
win a betfrance won the game and i won my bet.
lose a betif i have a bet, i always lose it.
make a bet(= risk money on the way a situation will develop in future)
if you want to make money on the stockmarket, you have to start making bets.

children.name: winnings
children.definition: an amount of money that has been won : tiền thắng cược, tiền trúng
examples: what are you going to spend your winnings on?
lottery winnings

children.name: slot machine x
children.definition: slot machine/ fruit machineuk  a machine that you try to win money from by putting coins into it and operating it, often by pressing a button or pulling a handle : máy đánh bạc

children.name: shaker x
children.definition: shaker a small container for shaking dice : hộp lắc

children.name: scratchcard x
children.definition: scratchcard/scratch card uk a small card that you can buy to try to win a prize and which has a covering that you rub off in order to see if you have winning numbers written on it : thẻ cào
examples: a lottery scratchcard

children.name: dice c2
children.definition: dice a small block of wood, plastic etc that has six sides with a different number of spots on each side, used in games: súc sắc
examples: we need two dice to play the game.
throw/ roll the dice
it’s your turn to roll the dice.
youroll/throwthe dice and whoever gets the highest score goes first.

children.name: chip x
children.definition: chip a small plastic disc used to represent a particular amount of money in gambling : thẻ tiền
examples: a poker chip
that was a mercenary term for a poker game with fake chips, one just played for relaxation.
figurativethe hostages are being held as abargainingchip by terrorist organizations.

children.name: lose money on a2
children.definition: lose money on to lose money by not guessing correctly the result of a game, race, or competition:thua cược
examples: he claims that he lost the money on a dice game.
i lost a lot of money on the dogs last night.

children.name: win money on a2
children.definition: win money on to win money by correctly guessing the result of a game, race, or competition: thắng cược
examples: i heard that he won a lot of money on the superbowl a few years ago.

children.name: lottery b1
children.definition: lottery a game used to make money for a state or a charity in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. if their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize : xổ số
examples: a lottery ticket
do you really thinkwinning the lotterywould make you happy?
national/state lottery

children.name: betting x
children.definition: betting en people risk money on the results of games, competitions etc or other future events: cá độ, cá cược
examples: betting can be as addictive as drinking or smoking

children.name: gambling b2
children.definition: gambling when people risk money or possessions on the result of something which is not certain, such as a card game or a horse race:cờ bạc, cá cược
examples: is gambling legal here?
your uncle maury has a gambling problem.
crane admits that he is addicted to gambling.
he was against the introduction of a national lottery as he thought it might encourage gambling.
the lottery is probably the most popular form of gambling.
gambling debts
gambling dens(= places for illegal gambling)ổ cờ bạc
the police raided a number of illegalgambling dens(= places for illegal gambling).

children.name: bingo x
children.definition: bingo a game in which prizes can be won by matching numbers on a card with those chosen by chance trò chơi bin-gô
examples: vera won £20 at bingo.

children.name: roulette x
children.definition: roulettea game of chance in which a small ball is dropped onto a wheel that is spinning and the players guess in which hole it will finally stop : cò quay
examples: the site offers slots, roulette and animated card games including poker and blackjack.

children.name: betting shop x
children.definition: betting shop uk a place in britain where people go to place bets on the results of races, competitions etc: văn phòng đánh cá
examples: ‘i was the school bookmaker, worked in betting shops and racecourses,’ he says.

children.name: casino x
children.definition: casinoa place where people try to win money by playing card games or roulette : sòng bạc
examples: doesn’t that club have a casino upstairs?

children.name: bookmaker's x
children.definition: bookmaker's (informalbookie’s) a place where bookmakers work:
examples: he went down to the bookmaker's/ bookie's in chesterton road to place a bet on the race.
